text:
ILLEGAL WEIGHTS AND MEASURES.

On Monday the following cases of tradesmen having illegal scales, weights, and measures in their possession were heard before the magistrates at the Court house, Marylebone-lane:

J. Pocock, fishmonger, 290, Edgware-road, scale, 8oz short, fined 10s—J. Jones, baker, 50, Princes-street, Lissom-grove, scales & drachms short, 10s—C. Cooley, coal-dealer, 20, Townsend-cottages, Portland-town, a 14lb weight 3oz short, a 7lb weight 2oz short, and 3 other weights deficient, 10s—Catherine Gascoyne, Princess Royal, 100, Cochrane-street, St. John's-wood, defective spirit measures, 10s—H. Welch, butcher, 134, High-street, St. John's-wood, scales 3oz deficient, 10s—Rebecca Wallis, marine-store dealer, 81, Great Castle-street East, scales 2oz deficient, 10s—G. Winkworth, general dealer, 16, Wells-street, Oxford-street, scales 3oz deficient, 20s—A. C. Browne, tallow chandler, 22, Wells-street, scales 2oz short, 10s—E. Rippington, pork-butcher, 35, Upper Marylebone-street, scales ½oz short, third offence, 20s—A. Carter, costermonger, 7, Fitzroy-market, scales and 2 weights short, second offence, 5s.
